sentences: Becky Hobbs (born January 24, 1950, in Bartlesville, Oklahoma, United States) is an American country singer, songwriter and pianist.
Besides her work as a solo artist, Hobbs has also written for several country and pop acts, such as Helen Reddy, George Jones, Loretta Lynn, and Shelly West, as well as Conway Twitty's 1987 single
"I Want to Know You Before We Make Love", Alabama's 1994 single "Angels Among Us" and Ken Mellons' 1995 single "Rub-a-Dubbin'".
